definition: to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: You can buy a ticket on the train from the ticket inspector.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在火车上向查票员买票。

sentences.english: Don't throw your bus ticket away--the inspector may want to see it.
sentences.chinese: 别把你的车票丢掉，查票员可能查看。

sentences.english: A ticket inspector got on the train.
A quick-thinking ticket inspector yanked an emergency cord .
sentences.chinese: 一个反应迅速的查票员猛地拉下了紧急刹车索。

sentences.english: The inspector was shining a flashlight onto the tickets .
sentences.chinese: 查票员打着手电筒查看车票。

definition: to inspect a ticket/to examine a ballot
to buy or upgrade a ticket after boarding a train, boat etc/to buy a ticket for a show after having sat down in the theater
to sneak in without a ticket/to stow away
to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
